title-group.article-title: Crosswind Smear and Pointwise Errors in Streamline Diffusion Finite Element Methods

abstract.p: For a model convection-dominated singularly perturbed convection-diffusion problem, it is shown that crosswind smear in the numerical streamline diffusion finite element method is minimized by introducing a judicious amount of artificial crosswind diffusion. The ensuing method with piecewise linear elements converges with a pointwise accuracy of almost $h^{5/4}$ under local smoothness assumptions.
